oneOf.title: Scan Changes with User Defined Cursor
oneOf.description: Incrementally detects new inserts and updates using the cursor column chosen when configuring a connection (e.g. created_at, updated_at).

oneOf.title: Read Changes using Change Data Capture (CDC)
oneOf.description: Recommended - Incrementally reads new inserts, updates, and deletes using Mysql's change data capture feature. This must be enabled on your database.

cursor.title: Update Method
cursor.description: Configures how data is extracted from the database.

schemas.title: Schemas
schemas.description: The list of schemas to sync from. Defaults to user. Case sensitive.

password.title: Password
password.description: The password associated with the username.

username.title: User
username.description: The username which is used to access the database.

oneOf.title: preferred
oneOf.description: To allow unencrypted communication only when the source doesn't support encryption.

oneOf.title: required
oneOf.description: To always require encryption. Note: The connection will fail if the source doesn't support encryption.

ssl_client_certificate.title: Client certificate File
ssl_client_certificate.description: Client certificate (this is not a required field, but if you want to use it, you will need to add the Client key as well)

ssl_client_key_password.title: Client key password
ssl_client_key_password.description: Password for keystorage. This field is optional. If you do not add it - the password will be generated automatically.

encryption.title: Encryption

concurrency.title: Concurrency

oneOf.description: No ssh tunnel needed to connect to database

ssh_key.title: SSH Private Key
ssh_key.description: OS-level user account ssh key credentials in RSA PEM format ( created with ssh-keygen -t rsa -m PEM -f myuser_rsa )

tunnel_host.title: SSH Tunnel Jump Server Host
tunnel_host.description: Hostname of the jump server host that allows inbound ssh tunnel.

tunnel_port.title: SSH Connection Port
tunnel_port.description: Port on the proxy/jump server that accepts inbound ssh connections.

tunnel_user.title: SSH Login Username
tunnel_user.description: OS-level username for logging into the jump server host

tunnel_host.description: Hostname of the jump server host that allows inbound ssh tunnel.

tunnel_port.title: SSH Connection Port
tunnel_port.description: Port on the proxy/jump server that accepts inbound ssh connections.

tunnel_user.title: SSH Login Username
tunnel_user.description: OS-level username for logging into the jump server host

tunnel_user_password.title: Password
tunnel_user_password.description: OS-level password for logging into the jump server host

tunnel_method.title: SSH Tunnel Method
tunnel_method.description: Whether to initiate an SSH tunnel before connecting to the database, and if so, which kind of authentication to use.

jdbc_url_params.title: JDBC URL Params
jdbc_url_params.description: Additional properties to pass to the JDBC URL string when connecting to the database formatted as 'key=value' pairs separated by the symbol '&'. (example: key1=value1&key2=value2&key3=value3).

check_privileges.title: Check Table and Column Access Privileges
check_privileges.description: When this feature is enabled, during schema discovery the connector will query each table or view individually to check access privileges and inaccessible tables, views, or columns therein will be removed. In large schemas, this might cause schema discovery to take too long, in which case it might be advisable to disable this feature.

checkpoint_target_interval_seconds.title: Checkpoint Target Time Interval
checkpoint_target_interval_seconds.description: How often (in seconds) a stream should checkpoint, when possible.
